Name: Ted Kazcynski
Ideology: Anti-government, anti-technology. His philosophy resembles primitivism and green anarchism
Social Media: Sent letters to the New York Times
Influences: None/Unknown

Name: Timothy McVeigh, Terry Nichols
Social Media: Letters to sent to News Outlets
Influences:
"Attack was made on the second anniversary of the end of the Waco Siege. McVeigh had expressed anger at the government's handling of the Ruby Ridge standoff and Waco siege.

He's also reported to have joined a KKK branch in Arkansas and blamed equal opportunity laws for his lack of job prospects. "

Name: Anders Breivik
Target: Oslo government offices and Workers' Youth League (AUF) summer camp in Utoya.
Social Media: Active on Stormfront (neo-nazi website) and Document.no (Islam-critical Norwegian site).
Influences: Sections of his manifesto copied from the Unabomber's manifesto.

Name: Brunon Kwiecień
Social Media: Praised Anders Breivik, made anti government remarks online
Influences: None/Unknown

Name: Dylann Roof
Ideology: White supremacy, race motivated, igniting a "race war"
Social Media: Personal website. Active on Stormfront, Daily Stormer
Affiliations: Generated a right-wing group, the "bowl patrol", after his haircut
Influences: Reportedly influenced by the killing of Trayvon Martin and the 2015 Baltimore protests. In his manifesto, he reports being self-radicalized after googling "black on white crime"

Name: Alexandre Bissonnette
Target: Islamic Cultural Centre of Quebec City
Social Media: Twitter
Influences: Told police he was motivated by the 2014 shooting of a Canadian soldier by a Lybian-Canadian Islam convert with addiction and mental health issues.

Name: Devon Arthurs
Ideology: Converted to Islam, shot neo-nazi roommates in retaliation for mockery
Social Media: None
Affiliations: Attomwaffen Division, later Salafist National Socialist
Influences: Claims to have been preventing further terrorist plots by Attomwaffen roommates

Name: Darren Osborne
Social Media: Twitter
Influences: Turned against Muslims in the wake of the London Bridge attack on 3 June 2017.

Name: Luca Traini
Social Media: None
Influences: Said to have been motivated by the prior killing of an 18-year old girl, allegedly by an African asylum seeker.

Name: Robert Bowers
Social Media: Gab, active on other right wing sites
Affiliations: Supporter of the Rise Above Movement (RAM) and Proud Boy, links to several neo-nazi organisations
Influences:
He wrote ""Screw your optics, I'm going in"" on Gab on the day of his attack, referencing the ongoing debate about the optics of white nationalism in the wake of the Charlottesville riot.

His writing also echoed Dylann Roof of the Charleston murders.

Name: Brenton Tarrant
Social Media: Active on 8chan, 4chan, livestreamed attack on Facebook.
Affiliations: Connected with several right-wing organizations throughout the world, including European and Balkan nationalists, Azov Division, among others.
Influences: Wrote the names of previous offenders (Traini, Bisonnette, Darren Osbourne) as well as the victims of murders by Islamic extremists (Ebba Åkerlund, victim in the 2017 Stockholm truck attack) on his weapons and magazines

Name: John Earnest
Social Media: Active on 8chan, 4chan, livestreamed attack on Facebook (attempted)
Affiliations: Online radicalisation, member of the Orthodox Presbyterian Church.
Influences: Manifesto claims to have been inspired by the Christchurch shooter and Robert Bowers.

Name: Patrick Crusius
Target: Largely Hispanic shoppers at a Walmart
Social Media: 8chan
Affiliations: Supporter of the Great Replacement theory
Influences: Manifesto claims to have been inspired by the Christchurch shooter

Name: Philip Manshaus
Social Media: Endchan. Attempted livestream on Facebook Live.
Affiliations: Tried to join Nordic Resistance Movement. Supporter of Nazi collaboration.
Influences:
Posted messages on Endchan praising the Christchurch shooter. 

Also shared a meme depicting Tarrant, Patrick Crusius, and John Earnest as ""chads"".

Name: Stephan Balliet
Social Media: Meguca, 4chan, livestreamed on Facebook
Influences: His manifesto referred to Breivik and the Christchurch, El Paso attackers as 'heroes'

Name: Kankaanpää Terror Plot
Social Media: Unknown
Affiliations: Attomwaffen Division Finland, links to Nordic Resistance Movement
Influences: Bomb materials and method copied from Anders Breivik

Name: Tobias Rathjen
Social Media: Telegram; had previously contacted the authorities with about conspiracy theories
Influences:
"After the attack, the shooter went back to his apartment, killed his mother and then committed suicide. 

In addition to his racist and xenophobic motivations, the shooter also expressed his frustration at his lack of relationships with women."

Name: Hugo Jackson
Social Media: Livestream on Twitch
Influences:
"He quoted the perpetrator of the Christchurch attack at the beginning of his livestream.

Jackson was a self-described white supremacist despite being non-white."

Name: Payton Gendron
Target: Tops Friendly Markets, supermarket in predominantly black neighbourhood.
Social Media: Livestream on Twitch, active on the Daily Stormer and Discord. Kept an online diary.
Influences: On his rifle he wrote the names of previous killers Dylann Roof, Robert Bowers, Brenton Tarrant, and John Earnest, the acronym SYGAOWN (Stop Your Genocide Against Our White Nations)

Name: Robert "Bobby" Crimo III
Social Media: Active on 4chan, Discord.
Affiliations: Supporter of former President Donald Trump, frequented far-right gatherings
Influences: Focus on aesthetics and performance rather than ideology. Copied several online activities of previous mass shooters.

Name: Juraj Krajčík
Ideology: White nationalism, far-right extremism, anti-LGBT, antisemitism
Social Media: Livestream on Twitter, active on Twitter, Telegram and 4chan.
Influences: Manifesto celebrates other far-right shooters, including Anders Breivik, Brenton Tarrant and John Earnest

Name: Anderson Lee Aldrich
Social Media: Hosted his own neo-Nazi website, sharing violent and racist content, including video from the 2022 Buffalo Shooting.
Influences: Aldrich allegedly created a website that included a video that advocated killing civilians to "cleanse society" and linked to a "brother website" that had hosted footage of the 2022 Buffalo shooting

Name: Ryan Palmeter
Social Media: Unknown
Influences: Palmeter was wearing a vest with a Rhodesian Army patch on it, just like Dylann Roof and the Christchurch shooter before him. Also referenced the Oklahoma City Bombings and the Turner Diaries.
